classes.name: AudioChannel
classes.description:
Individual audio channel with full control.

Attributes:
   channel_id (int): Pygame mixer channel number
   sound (pygame.mixer.Sound): The sound object
   volume (float): Current volume (0.0 to 1.0)
   speed (float): Playback speed multiplier
   loop (bool): Whether to loop the sound
   state (AudioState): Current playback state

classes.name: SoundEffect
classes.description:
Sound effect that can be played on multiple channels simultaneously.

Attributes:
   sound (pygame.mixer.Sound): The sound object
   channels (List[AudioChannel]): Channels currently playing this sound

classes.name: AudioSystem
classes.description:
Advanced audio system with multi-channel support and real speed control.

Attributes:
   music_volume (float): Global music volume
   sfx_volume (float): Global sound effects volume
   channels (List[AudioChannel]): All available audio channels
   sound_effects (Dict[str, SoundEffect]): Loaded sound effects
   music_channel (AudioChannel): Dedicated music channel

classes.name: InputState
classes.description: Tracks input state with proper click detection

classes.name: LunaEngine
classes.description:
Main game engine class for LunaEngine.

This class manages the entire game lifecycle including initialization,
scene management, event handling, rendering, and shutdown.

Attributes:
   title (str): Window title
   width (int): Window width
   height (int): Window height
   running (bool): Whether the engine is running
   clock (pygame.time.Clock): Game clock for FPS control
   scenes (Dict[str, Scene]): Registered scenes
   current_scene (Scene): Currently active scene

classes.name: Renderer
classes.description: Abstract base class for all renderers in LunaEngine.

classes.name: Scene
classes.description:
Base class for all game scenes.

Provides lifecycle methods and UI element management.
All custom scenes should inherit from this class.

Attributes:
   ui_elements (List[UIElement]): List of UI elements in this scene
   _initialized (bool): Whether the scene has been initialized
   engine (LunaEngine): Reference to the game engine

classes.name: Window
classes.description:
Manages the game window and display settings.

This class handles window creation, resizing, fullscreen mode,
and provides utility methods for window information.

Attributes:
   title (str): Window title
   width (int): Window width
   height (int): Window height
   fullscreen (bool): Whether window is in fullscreen mode
   resizable (bool): Whether window is resizable
   surface (pygame.Surface): The window surface

classes.name: _UIDGenerator
classes.description:
Internal class for generating unique IDs for UI elements.

Generates IDs in the format: ui_{element_type}_{counter}
Example: ui_button_1, ui_label_2, ui_dropdown_1

classes.name: UIState
classes.description: Enumeration of possible UI element states.

classes.name: FontManager
classes.description: Manages fonts and ensures Pygame font system is initialized.

classes.name: UIElement
classes.description:
Base class for all UI elements providing common functionality.

Attributes:
   element_id (str): Unique identifier for this element in format ui_{type}_{counter}
   x (int): X coordinate position
   y (int): Y coordinate position
   width (int): Width of the element in pixels
   height (int): Height of the element in pixels
   root_point (Tuple[float, float]): Anchor point for positioning
   state (UIState): Current state of the element
   visible (bool): Whether element is visible
   enabled (bool): Whether element is enabled
   children (List[UIElement]): Child elements
   parent (UIElement): Parent element

classes.description: UI element for displaying text labels.

classes.description: Layout that arranges elements in a grid.

classes.name: JustifiedLayout
classes.description: Layout that justifies elements with equal spacing.

classes.name: UIState
classes.description: Enumeration of possible UI element states.

classes.name: UIStyle
classes.description: Defines the visual style for UI elements.

classes.name: Theme
classes.description: Collection of styles for different UI elements forming a complete theme.

classes.description: Complete UI theme configuration for all elements

classes.name: ParallaxLayer
classes.description: Otimizado: Camada de parallax com renderização eficiente

classes.description: Sistema de parallax otimizado para múltiplas camadas

classes.name: Camera
classes.description: Advanced 2D Camera system with smooth movement and effects.

classes.name: ShadowSystem
classes.description: Optimized shadow system for OpenGL rendering with stable performance

classes.name: SpriteSheet
classes.description:
Main sprite sheet class for managing and extracting sprites from texture atlases.

This class handles loading sprite sheets with alpha support and provides
multiple methods for extracting individual sprites or sprite sequences.

Attributes:
   sheet (pygame.Surface): The loaded sprite sheet surface with alpha
   filename (str): Path to the sprite sheet file
   width (int): Width of the sprite sheet
   height (int): Height of the sprite sheet

classes.name: Animation
classes.description:
Time-based animation system for sprite sequences with fade effects.

This class automatically extracts frames from a sprite sheet based on
the provided parameters and manages animation timing with alpha transitions.

Attributes:
   spritesheet (SpriteSheet): The source sprite sheet
   frames (List[pygame.Surface]): List of animation frames
   frame_count (int): Total number of frames in the animation
   current_frame_index (int): Current frame index in the animation
   duration (float): Total animation duration in seconds
   frame_duration (float): Duration of each frame in seconds
   last_update_time (float): Last time the animation was updated
   scale (Tuple[float, float]): Scale factors for the animation
   loop (bool): Whether the animation should loop
   playing (bool): Whether the animation is currently playing
   fade_in_duration (float): Duration of fade-in effect in seconds
   fade_out_duration (float): Duration of fade-out effect in seconds
   fade_alpha (int): Current alpha value for fade effects (0-255)
   fade_mode (str): Current fade mode: 'in', 'out', or None

classes.name: ImageConverter
classes.description:
Converts images to Python code for embedding in games
Uses Pygame for image loading - NO PILLOW REQUIRED

classes.name: EmbeddedImage
classes.description: Helper class for working with embedded images

classes.name: PerformanceMonitor
classes.description: Optimized performance monitoring with minimal overhead

classes.description: Generic shader program for 2D rendering with caching

classes.description: OPTIMIZED shader for particle rendering with instancing

classes.name: SimpleShader
classes.description: Simple shader for solid color rendering

classes.name: PygameRenderer
classes.description:
Pygame-based software renderer for LunaEngine

LOCATION: lunaengine/backend/pygame_backend.py

DESCRIPTION:
Provides a simple, reliable software renderer using Pygame's built-in
drawing functions. Serves as a fallback when OpenGL is not available
or for development purposes.

FEATURES:
- Software-based 2D rendering
- Basic shape drawing (rectangles, circles, lines)
- Surface blitting and composition
- Cross-platform compatibility

LIBRARIES USED:
- pygame: Core graphics, surface management, and drawing primitives

INHERITS FROM:
- Renderer: Base renderer class from core module

USAGE:
>>> renderer = PygameRenderer(800, 600)
>>> renderer.initialize()
>>> renderer.draw_rect(100, 100, 50, 50, (255, 0, 0))

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize an audio channel.

Args:
   channel_id (int): Pygame mixer channel number

methods.name: play
methods.description:
Play a sound on this channel.

Args:
   sound (pygame.mixer.Sound): Sound to play
   loop (bool, optional): Whether to loop. Defaults to False.
   
Returns:
   bool: True if playback started successfully

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stop playback on this channel.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pause playback on this channel.

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resume playback on this channel.

methods.name: set_volume
methods.description:
Set channel volume.

Args:
   volume (float): Volume level (0.0 to 1.0)

methods.name: set_speed
methods.description:
Set playback speed using pitch adjustment.

Note: This is a simulated effect since pygame doesn't support native speed control.
We adjust the playback rate by manipulating the sound buffer.

Args:
   speed (float): Speed multiplier (0.5 for half speed, 2.0 for double)

methods.name: fade_in
methods.description:
Fade in the channel volume.

Args:
   duration (float): Fade duration in seconds
   target_volume (float, optional): Target volume. Defaults to 1.0.

methods.name: fade_out
methods.description:
Fade out the channel volume.

Args:
   duration (float): Fade duration in seconds

methods.name: _fade_volume
methods.description:
Internal method to handle volume fading.

Args:
   start_volume (float): Starting volume
   end_volume (float): Ending volume
   duration (float): Fade duration in seconds
   fade_state (AudioState): Current fade state

methods.name: is_playing
methods.description:
Check if the channel is playing.

Returns:
   bool: True if playing, False otherwise

methods.name: is_paused
methods.description:
Check if the channel is paused.

Returns:
   bool: True if paused, False otherwise

methods.name: on_event
methods.description:
Decorator to register event handlers.

Args:
   event_type (AudioEvent): The event type to listen for
   
Returns:
   Callable: The decorator function

methods.name: _trigger_event
methods.description: Trigger all handlers for the given event type.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize a sound effect.

Args:
   sound (pygame.mixer.Sound): The sound object

methods.name: play
methods.description:
Play the sound effect on an available channel.

Args:
   audio_system (AudioSystem): The audio system to get channels from
   volume (float, optional): Volume level. Defaults to 1.0.
   speed (float, optional): Playback speed. Defaults to 1.0.
   loop (bool, optional): Whether to loop. Defaults to False.
   
Returns:
   Optional[AudioChannel]: The channel playing the sound, or None if failed

methods.name: stop_all
methods.description: Stop all instances of this sound effect.

methods.description:
Initialize the advanced audio system.

Args:

methods.description:
Get an available audio channel.

Returns:

methods.description:

methods.description:
Load a music track (store path for later use).

methods.description:
Play a sound effect on an available channel.

Returns:

methods.name: play_music
methods.description:
Play a music track on the dedicated music channel.

Args:
   name (str): Name of the music track
   volume (float, optional): Volume level. Uses music volume if None.
   speed (float, optional): Playback speed. Defaults to 1.0.
   loop (bool, optional): Whether to loop. Defaults to True.
   
Returns:
   bool: True if playback started successfully

methods.name: stop_music
methods.description: Stop the currently playing music.

methods.name: pause_music
methods.description: Pause the currently playing music.

methods.name: resume_music
methods.description: Resume the paused music.

methods.name: set_music_volume
methods.description:
Set global music volume.

Args:
   volume (float): Volume level (0.0 to 1.0)

methods.name: set_sfx_volume
methods.description:
Set global sound effects volume.

Args:
   volume (float): Volume level (0.0 to 1.0)

methods.name: fade_in_music
methods.description:
Fade in a music track.

Args:
   name (str): Name of the music track
   duration (float, optional): Fade duration. Defaults to 2.0.
   target_volume (float, optional): Target volume. Uses music volume if None.
   speed (float, optional): Playback speed. Defaults to 1.0.
   
Returns:
   bool: True if fade started successfully

methods.name: fade_out_music
methods.description:
Fade out the current music.

Args:
   duration (float, optional): Fade duration. Defaults to 2.0.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize the LunaEngine.

Args:

methods.name: shutdown

methods.description:
Get the maximum number of particles supported by the renderer.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description:
Initialize the renderer and required resources.

This method should set up the rendering context, create shaders (if applicable),
allocate buffers, and prepare the renderer for drawing operations.

methods.name: begin_frame
methods.description:
Begin a new rendering frame.

This typically involves clearing the screen, resetting render states,
and preparing for new drawing commands.

methods.name: end_frame
methods.description:
End the current rendering frame.

This typically involves swapping buffers, finalizing rendering operations,
and preparing for display.

methods.name: get_surface
methods.description:
Get the main rendering surface.

Returns:
   pygame.Surface: The current rendering surface

methods.name: set_surface
methods.description:
Set a custom surface for rendering.

Args:
   surface (pygame.Surface): Surface to use as render target

methods.name: draw_surface
methods.description:
Draw a pygame surface at specified coordinates.

Args:
   surface (pygame.Surface): The surface to draw
   x (int): X coordinate
   y (int): Y coordinate

methods.name: render_surface
methods.description:
Alternative method for drawing surfaces (OpenGL compatibility).

Args:
   surface (pygame.Surface): The surface to draw
   x (int): X coordinate
   y (int): Y coordinate

methods.name: draw_rect
methods.description:
Draw a colored rectangle.

Args:
   x (int): X coordinate of top-left corner
   y (int): Y coordinate of top-left corner
   width (int): Rectangle width
   height (int): Rectangle height
   color (Tuple[int, int, int]): RGB color tuple
   fill (bool): Whether to fill the rectangle (default: True)
   border_width (int): Border width for unfilled rectangles (default: 1)

methods.name: draw_circle
methods.description:
Draw a circle with specified center, radius and color.

Args:

   center_y (int): Center Y coordinate
   radius (int): Circle radius
   color (Tuple[int, int, int]): RGB color tuple
   fill (bool): Whether to fill the circle (default: True)
   border_width (int): Border width for hollow circles (default: 1)

methods.name: draw_line
methods.description:
Draw a line between two points with specified width.

Args:
   start_x (int): Start X coordinate
   start_y (int): Start Y coordinate
   end_x (int): End X coordinate
   end_y (int): End Y coordinate
   color (Tuple[int, int, int]): RGB color tuple
   width (int): Line width (default: 1)

methods.name: draw_polygon
methods.description:
Draw a polygon from a list of points.

Args:

   color (Tuple[int, int, int]): RGB color tuple
   fill (bool): Whether to fill the polygon (default: True)
   border_width (int): Border width for hollow polygons (default: 1)

methods.name: draw_text
methods.description: Draw text using pygame font rendering

methods.name: enable_scissor
methods.description:
Enable scissor test for clipping region.

Args:
   x (int): X position from left (pygame coordinate system)
   y (int): Y position from top (pygame coordinate system)  
   width (int): Width of scissor region
   height (int): Height of scissor region

methods.name: disable_scissor
methods.description: Disable scissor test.

methods.name: render_particles
methods.description:
Render particle systems with optimized batch processing.

Args:
   particle_data (Dict[str, Any]): Particle system data containing:
       - positions: Array of particle positions
       - sizes: Array of particle sizes
       - colors: Array of particle colors
       - alphas: Array of particle alpha values
       - active_count: Number of active particles
   camera (Any): Camera object for coordinate transformations

methods.name: render_opengl
methods.description:
OpenGL-specific rendering method for profiling detection.

Args:
   renderer: Renderer instance
   
Returns:
   bool: Always returns True for OpenGL detection

methods.name: cleanup
methods.description:
Clean up rendering resources and shutdown the renderer.

This method should release all allocated resources, delete shaders,
buffers, and perform any necessary cleanup operations.

methods.name: blit
methods.description:
Blit a source surface onto the current render target.
Works similarly to pygame.Surface.blit().

Args:
   source_surface: Surface to blit from
   dest_rect: Destination rectangle (x, y, width, height) or (x, y)
   area: Source area to blit from (None for entire surface)
   special_flags: Additional blitting flags (currently unused)

Initialize a new scene with empty UI elements list.

Args:

methods.description:
Called when the scene becomes active.

Use this to initialize resources, create UI elements, or reset game state.

Args:
   previous_scene (str, optional): Name of the previous scene

methods.name: on_exit
methods.description:
Called when the scene is being replaced.

Use this to clean up resources, save game state, or perform transitions.

Args:
   next_scene (str, optional): Name of the next scene

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update scene logic.

methods.name: render
methods.description:
Render the scene.

Called every frame to draw the scene content.

Args:
   renderer: The renderer to use for drawing operations

Returns:

Get UI element by its unique ID.

Get all UI elements in the scene.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description:
Initialize the font system.

This method should be called before using any font-related functionality.
It initializes Pygame's font module if not already initialized.

methods.name: get_font
methods.description:
Get a font object for rendering text.

Args:
   font_name (Optional[str]): Path to font file or None for default system font.
   font_size (int): Size of the font in pixels.
   
Returns:
   pygame.font.Font: A font object ready for text rendering.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize a UI element with position and dimensions.

Args:
   x (int): X coordinate position.
   y (int): Y coordinate position.
   width (int): Width of the element in pixels.
   height (int): Height of the element in pixels.
   root_point (Tuple[float, float]): Anchor point for positioning where (0,0) is top-left
                                   and (1,1) is bottom-right.
   element_id (Optional[str]): Custom element ID. If None, generates automatic ID.

methods.name: get_id
methods.description:
Get the unique ID of this UI element.

Returns:
   str: The unique element ID

methods.name: set_id
methods.description:
Set a new unique ID for this UI element.

Args:
   new_id (str): The new unique ID to set

methods.name: get_actual_position
methods.description:
Calculate actual screen position based on root_point anchor.

Args:
   parent_width (int): Width of parent element if applicable.
   parent_height (int): Height of parent element if applicable.
   
Returns:
   Tuple[int, int]: The actual (x, y) screen coordinates.

methods.name: add_child
methods.description:
Add a child element to this UI element.

   input_state: The input state manager for event consumption

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update element state.

Args:
   dt (float): Delta time in seconds since last update.

methods.name: update_theme
methods.description:
Update the theme for this element and all its children.

Args:
   theme_type (ThemeType): The new theme to apply.

methods.name: _update_with_mouse
methods.description:
Update element with current mouse state for interaction.

Args:
   mouse_pos (Tuple[int, int]): Current mouse position (x, y).
   mouse_pressed (bool): Whether mouse button is currently pressed.
   dt (float): Delta time in seconds.

methods.description:
Initialize a UI Frame container element.

Args:
   x (int): X coordinate position.
   y (int): Y coordinate position.
   width (int): Width of the frame in pixels.
   height (int): Height of the frame in pixels.
   root_point (Tuple[float, float]): Anchor point for positioning.
   theme (ThemeType): Theme to use for frame styling.
   element_id (Optional[str]): Custom element ID. If None, generates automatic ID.

methods.description:
Set the background color of the frame.

Args:
   color (Optional[Tuple[int, int, int]]): RGB color tuple or None for transparent.

methods.description:
Set the border properties of the frame.

Args:
   color (Optional[Tuple[int, int, int]]): Border color or None for no border.

methods.description:
Set the padding inside the frame.

Args:

Add a child element to this frame with automatic positioning.

Args:

methods.description:
Get the rectangle area available for child elements (inside padding).

Update the theme for this frame and all its children.

methods.name: arrange_children_horizontally
methods.description:
Arrange child elements horizontally within the frame.

Args:
   spacing (int): Space between children in pixels.

   count: The number of particles to emit (default: 1)
   exit_point: The exit point of the particle (default: ExitPoint.CENTER)
   physics_type: The physics type of the particle (default: PhysicsType.TOPDOWN)
   spread: The spread of the particle (default: None) is in degrees
   angle: The angle of the particle (default: 0.0)
   custom_config: Optional custom configuration

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize the sprite sheet with alpha support.

Args:
   filename (str): Path to the sprite sheet image file

methods.name: get_sprite_at_rect
methods.description:
Extract a sprite from a specific rectangular region.

Args:
   rect (pygame.Rect): Rectangle defining the sprite region (x, y, width, height)

Returns:
   pygame.Surface: The extracted sprite surface with alpha

Raises:
   ValueError: If the rect is outside the sprite sheet bounds

methods.name: get_sprites_at_regions
methods.description:
Extract multiple sprites from a list of rectangular regions.

Args:
   regions (List[pygame.Rect]): List of rectangles defining sprite regions

Returns:
   List[pygame.Surface]: List of extracted sprite surfaces

methods.name: get_sprite_grid
methods.description:
Extract a sprite from a grid-based sprite sheet.

Args:
   cell_size (Tuple[int, int]): Width and height of each grid cell
   grid_pos (Tuple[int, int]): Grid coordinates (col, row)

Returns:
   pygame.Surface: The extracted sprite surface

methods.name: get_surface_drawn_area
methods.description:
Get the bounding rectangle of the non-transparent (drawn) area of a surface.

This function analyzes the alpha channel of the surface to find the smallest
rectangle that contains all non-transparent pixels, creating a tight hitbox.

Args:
   surface (pygame.Surface): Surface to analyze (must have alpha channel)
   threshold (int): Alpha threshold value (0-255). Pixels with alpha >= threshold
                   are considered drawn. Default is 1 (any non-fully-transparent).

Returns:
   pygame.Rect: Tight bounding rectangle around the non-transparent area.
               Returns empty Rect (0,0,0,0) if surface is fully transparent.

Raises:
   ValueError: If surface doesn't have per-pixel alpha

methods.name: __init__
methods.description:
Initialize the animation and automatically extract frames from sprite sheet.

Args:
   spritesheet_file (str): Path to the sprite sheet file
   size (Tuple[int, int]): Size of each sprite (width, height)
   start_pos (Tuple[int, int]): Starting position in the sprite sheet (x, y)
   frame_count (int): Number of frames to extract for the animation
   padding (Tuple[int, int]): Padding between sprites (x, y)
   margin (Tuple[int, int]): Margin around the sprite sheet (x, y)
   scale (Tuple[float, float]): Scale factors for the animation
   duration (float): Total animation duration in seconds
   loop (bool): Whether the animation should loop
   fade_in_duration (float): Duration of fade-in effect in seconds
   fade_out_duration (float): Duration of fade-out effect in seconds

methods.name: _extract_animation_frames
methods.description:
Automatically extract animation frames based on parameters.

Creates a sequence of rectangles and extracts the corresponding sprites
from the sprite sheet.

Returns:
   List[pygame.Surface]: List of extracted frames

methods.name: _apply_scaling
methods.description: Apply scaling to all animation frames.

methods.name: set_duration
methods.description:
Change the animation duration.

Args:
   new_duration (float): New total duration in seconds

methods.name: play
methods.description: Start or resume the animation.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pause the animation.

methods.name: get_frame_count
methods.description:
Get the number of frames in the animation.

Returns:
   int: Number of frames

methods.name: get_progress
methods.description:
Get the current progress of the animation (0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
   float: Animation progress from start (0.0) to end (1.0)

methods.name: _apply_fade_effect
methods.description:
Apply current fade alpha to a surface.

Args:
   surface (pygame.Surface): Original surface

Returns:
   pygame.Surface: Surface with fade effect applied

methods.name: update_fade
methods.description: Update fade-in and fade-out effects based on elapsed time.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update the animation based on elapsed time including fade effects.

This method uses time-based animation rather than frame-based,
making it frame-rate independent.

methods.name: get_current_frame
methods.description:
Get the current animation frame with fade effects applied.

Returns:
   pygame.Surface: The current frame surface with fade alpha

methods.name: start_fade_in
methods.description:
Start a fade-in effect.

Args:
   duration (float, optional): Override fade-in duration. If None, uses initialized value.

methods.name: start_fade_out
methods.description:
Start a fade-out effect.

Args:
   duration (float, optional): Override fade-out duration. If None, uses initialized value.

methods.name: set_fade_alpha
methods.description:
Manually set the fade alpha value.

Args:
   alpha (int): Alpha value from 0 (transparent) to 255 (opaque)

methods.name: is_fade_complete
methods.description:
Check if the current fade effect is complete.

Returns:
   bool: True if no fade effect is active or fade is complete

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Reset the animation to the first frame and reset fade effects.

methods.name: image_to_python_code
methods.description:
Convert an image to Python code with quality compression

Args:
   image_path: Path to the image file
   output_var_name: Name for the output variable
   max_size: Maximum dimensions (width, height)
   method: Conversion method ('pixel_array', 'base64', 'compressed')
   quality: Image quality (1.0 = original, 0.5 = half size, 0.25 = quarter size)
